TEXT.English: Your inhumanity will not be soon forgotten...
TEXT.French: Votre inhumanité ne sera pas oubliée de si tôt...
TEXT.German: Eure Unmenschlichkeit wird nicht leicht vergessen werden...
TEXT.Italian: Your inhumanity will not be soon forgotten...
TEXT.Spanish: Your inhumanity will not be soon forgotten...

TEXT.English: Loyalty with Honor, Courage with Valor, Warmongering with Wrath, and Folly with Doom!
TEXT.French: Fidélité avec honneur, Courage avec Valeur, Bellicisme avec Colère, et Folie avec Destruction!
TEXT.German: Loyalität mit Ehre, Mut mit Tapferkeit, Kriegstreiberei mit Zorn, und Torheit mit Untergang!
TEXT.Italian: Loyalty with Honor, Courage with Valor, Warmongering with Wrath, and Folly with Doom!
TEXT.Spanish: Loyalty with Honor, Courage with Valor, Warmongering with Wrath, and Folly with Doom!

TEXT.English: This will be the undoing of us all!
TEXT.French: Ce sera la défaite de nous tous!
TEXT.German: Das bedeutet das Ende für uns alle!
TEXT.Italian: This will be the undoing of us all!
TEXT.Spanish: This will be the undoing of us all!

TEXT.English: We can no longer stand by and watch the carnage! You must end your war with the %s1!
TEXT.French: Nous ne pouvons plus rester là et regarde le carnage! Vous devez arrêter votre Guerre contre %s1!
TEXT.German: Wir können dem Gemetzel nicht länger zusehen und tatenlos bleiben! Ihr müßt den Krieg mit den %s1 beenden!
TEXT.Italian: We can no longer stand by and watch the carnage! You must end your war with the %s1!
TEXT.Spanish: We can no longer stand by and watch the carnage! You must end your war with the %s1!

TEXT.English: The war has gone on long enough! Make peace with %s1.
TEXT.French: La Guerre a durée assez longtemps! Faire la paix avec %s1.
TEXT.German: Der Krieg hat lange genug gedauert! Macht Frieden mit %s1.
TEXT.Italian: The war has gone on long enough! Make peace with %s1.
TEXT.Spanish: The war has gone on long enough! Make peace with %s1.

TEXT.English: %d1%: For Having an Embassy in their Nation.
TEXT.French: %d1%: pour avoir une Ambassade dans leur Nation.
TEXT.German: %d1%: Für eine Botschaft in ihrer Nation.
TEXT.Italian: %d1%: For Having an Embassy in their Nation.
TEXT.Spanish: %d1%: For Having an Embassy in their Nation.

TEXT.English: Advanced Diplomacy adds new diplomatic trading options, from embassies to trading military and worker units.
TEXT.French: Ajoute de nouvelles options diplomatiques, de l'ambassade aux échange d'unités militaires et civiles.
TEXT.German: Fortgeschrittene Diplomatie führt zu zusätzlichen Diplomatie-Optionen, von Botschaften zum Handel mit Militäreinheiten und Bautrupps.
TEXT.Italian: Advanced Diplomacy adds new diplomatic trading options, from embassies to trading military and worker units.
TEXT.Spanish: Advanced Diplomacy adds new diplomatic trading options, from embassies to trading military and worker units.

TEXT.English: [H1]Advanced Diplomacy[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Advanced Diplomacy vastly changes the way diplomacy works from standard Civilization. Many new trading options are added, each with their own benefits, and potiential disadvantages.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Embassies[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Nations can now establish embassies in other nations. Embassies improve diplomatic relations between countries, but be warned; revoking a foriegn embassies rights will have disastrous diplomatic repercussions with the other nation. Embassies also allow the trade of Military Units and Workers between countries. In addition, Embassies are now required to unlock higher diplomatic functions with other nations, namely, [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Open Borders Agreements[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Pacts.[COLOR_REVERT] Be warned, Embassies allow for enemy spies to more easily complete their missions in your country.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Right of Passage[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When players research [LINK=TECH_WRITING]Writing[\LINK], they can request to have a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Right of Passage[COLOR_REVERT] agreement between two civilizations. The agreement is similar to open borders, in that it allows foriegn trade, but the agreement only allows for defensive units to pass through the nations. Offensive units will not be able to enter the territory.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When players research [LINK=TECH_WRITING]Writing[\LINK], they can request to have a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Free Trade Agreement[COLOR_REVERT] between two civilizations. The agreement increases foriegn trade and reduces the cost of epsionage missions against the civ.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When players research [LINK=TECH_WRITING]Writing[\LINK], they can request to have a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Non-Aggression Pact[COLOR_REVERT] between two civilizations. The agreement increases foriegn trade and reduces the cost of epsionage missions against the civ.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When players research [LINK=TECH_WRITING]Writing[\LINK], they can request to have a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]POW Exchange[COLOR_REVERT] between two civilizations. The agreement increases foriegn trade and reduces the cost of epsionage missions against the civ.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Trading Military Units[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Certain Military units, like siege machines can be traded, with Advanced Diplomacy. To be traded, each player must have an embassy in the other players nation. Each tradable unit will be marked in it's respective civilopedia entry with "This unit is tradable."[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Trading Workers[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Workers, can be traded, with Advanced Diplomacy. To be traded, each player must have an embassy in the other players nation.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Pledging Votes[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Nations can pledge their vote for Secretary General. These pledges are binding, and can not be broken, excepting wars.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Buying and Selling of Corporations HQ's[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Nations, if they happen to own a corporation Headquarters, can also sell it to other nations, where it will be automatically moved to one of their cities. If a nation does not own the particular Corporation Headquarters, they can offer to buy it from the owner.[PARAGRAPH:2][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Trading Contacts[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Workers, can be traded, with Advanced Diplomacy. To be traded, each player must have an embassy in the other players nation.[PARAGRAPH:2][PARAGRAPH:2][PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Hiring War Allies[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Workers, can be traded, with Advanced Diplomacy. To be traded, each player must have an embassy in the other players nation.[PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.French: [H1]Diplomatie Avancée[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2] L'option de Diplomatie Avancée change de manière importante le mécanisme de la diplomatie avec les autres Civilisations. De nouvelles options d'échange sont ajoutés, avec leurs propres avantages et désavantages.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Embassades[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Les Nations peuvent maintenant établir des ambassades au seind es autres nations. Les Embassades améliorent les relations diplomatiques entre les civilisations. Par contre, le rappel de votre embassadeur pourrait avoir des répercutions importantes auprès de vos interlocuteurs. Les ambassades permettent également le commerce d'unités militaires et d'Ouvriers. L'Ambassade permt d'activer d'autres fonctions avancées, comme le [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Libre Passage[COLOR_REVERT] et les [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pactes Défensifs.[COLOR_REVERT] Soyez avertis : les Ambassades permettent aux espions ennemis d'exécuter plus facilement des actions dans notre territoire.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Droit de Passage[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Après la découverte de l'[LINK=TECH_WRITING]Ecriture[\LINK], Les Joueurs peuvent étblir des accords de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Droit de Passage[COLOR_REVERT]. Cet accord est similaire au Libre Passage, mais il limite l'autorisation de passage aux unités défensives et aux civils. Les Unités offensives ne sont pas autorisées à entre dans le Territoire.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Commerce d'unité militaires[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Certaines unités militaires, comme les machines de siège, peuvent être vendues. Pour cela, chaque joueur doit avoir une Ambassade avec les autre nations. Les Unités pouvant être vendue sont indiquées dans la civilopedia.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Commerce d'Ouvriers[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Les Ouvriers peuvent être vendus. Pour cela, chaque joueur doit avoir une Ambassade avec les autre nations.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Pledging Votes[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Nations can pledge their vote for Secretary General, or for a specific UN Resolution. These pledges are binding, and can not be
TEXT.German: [H1]Advanced Diplomacy[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Advanced Diplomacy vastly changes the way diplomacy works from standard Civilization. Many new trading options are added, each with their own benefits, and potiential disadvantages.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Embassies[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Nations can now establish embassies in other nations. Embassies improve diplomatic relations between countries, but be warned; revoking a foriegn embassies rights will have disastrous diplomatic repercussions with the other nation. Embassies also allow the trade of Military Units and Workers between countries. In addition, Embassies are now required to unlock higher diplomatic functions with other nations, namely, [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Open Borders Agreements[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Pacts.[COLOR_REVERT] Be warned, Embassies allow for enemy spies to more easily complete their missions in your country.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Right of Passage[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When players research [LINK=TECH_WRITING]Writing[\LINK], they can request to have a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Right of Passage[COLOR_REVERT] agreement between two civilizations. The agreement is similar to open borders, in that it allows foriegn trade, but the agreement only allows for defensive units to pass through the nations. Offensive units will not be able to enter the territory.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Trading Military Units[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Certain Military units, like siege machines can be traded, with Advanced Diplomacy. To be traded, each player must have an embassy in the other players nation. Each tradable unit will be marked in it's respective civilopedia entry with "This unit is tradable."[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Trading Workers[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Workers, can be traded, with Advanced Diplomacy. To be traded, each player must have an embassy in the other players nation.[PARAGRAPH:2][BOLD]Pledging Votes[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Nations can pledge their vote for Secretary General, or for a specific UN Resolution. These pledges are binding, and can not be

TEXT.English: "You have proven to be committed to peace."
TEXT.French: Vous avez prouvé être attaché à la Paix
TEXT.Italian: "You have proven to be committed to peace."
TEXT.Spanish: "You have proven to be committed to peace."

TEXT.English: "We pay a lot for your environmental degradations!"
TEXT.French: "Nous payons cher vos degradations de l'environnement !
TEXT.German: "We pay a lot for your environmental degradations!"
TEXT.Italian: "We pay a lot for your environmental degradations!"
TEXT.Spanish: "We pay a lot for your environmental degradations!"

TEXT.French: Vous êtes un Seigneur de Guerre!

TEXT.English: %D1: "Our Free Trade Agreement propels our economies."
TEXT.French: %D1: "Our Free Trade Agreement propels our economies."
TEXT.German: %D1: "Our Free Trade Agreement propels our economies."
TEXT.Italian: %D1: "Our Free Trade Agreement propels our economies."
TEXT.Spanish: %D1: "Our Free Trade Agreement propels our economies."

TEXT.English: %D1: "You let our people pass through your lands."
TEXT.French: %D1: "You let our people pass through your lands."
TEXT.German: %D1: "You let our people pass through your lands."
TEXT.Italian: %D1: "You let our people pass through your lands."
TEXT.Spanish: %D1: "You let our people pass through your lands."

TEXT.English: The evil %s1_CivAdj have convinced the treacherous %s2_CivAdj to declare war on us!
TEXT.French: Les sournois %s1_CivAdj ont convaincu les traîtres %s2_CivAdj de nous déclarer la Guerre!
TEXT.German: Die bösartigen %s1_CivAdj haben die hinterhältigen %s2_CivAdj davon überzeugt, uns den Krieg zu erklären!
TEXT.Italian: The evil %s1_CivAdj have convinced the treacherous %s2_CivAdj to declare war on us!
TEXT.Spanish: The evil %s1_CivAdj have convinced the treacherous %s2_CivAdj to declare war on us!

TEXT.English: The %s1 Civilization has broken its Non-Agression Pact with the %s2 Civilization!
TEXT.French: The %s1 Civilization has broken its Non-Agression Pact with the %s2 Civilization!
TEXT.German: The %s1 Civilization has broken its Non-Agression Pact with the %s2 Civilization!
TEXT.Italian: The %s1 Civilization has broken its Non-Agression Pact with the %s2 Civilization!
TEXT.Spanish: The %s1 Civilization has broken its Non-Agression Pact with the %s2 Civilization!

TEXT.English: The %s1 Civilization has broken its POW Agreement with the %s2 Civilization!
TEXT.French: The %s1 Civilization has broken its POW Agreement with the %s2 Civilization!
TEXT.German: The %s1 Civilization has broken its POW Agreement with the %s2 Civilization!
TEXT.Italian: The %s1 Civilization has broken its POW Agreement with the %s2 Civilization!
TEXT.Spanish: The %s1 Civilization has broken its POW Agreement with the %s2 Civilization!

TEXT.English: %s1 and %s2 signed a Non-Agression Pact to guarantee peace between their civilizations.
TEXT.French: %s1 and %s2 signed a Non-Agression Pact to guarantee peace between their civilizations.
TEXT.German: %s1 and %s2 signed a Non-Agression Pact to guarantee peace between their civilizations.
TEXT.Italian: %s1 and %s2 signed a Non-Agression Pact to guarantee peace between their civilizations.
TEXT.Spanish: %s1 and %s2 signed a Non-Agression Pact to guarantee peace between their civilizations.

TEXT.English: %s1 and %s2 have agreed to exchange POW's from their conflict.
TEXT.French: %s1 and %s2 have agreed to exchange POW's from their conflict.
TEXT.German: %s1 and %s2 have agreed to exchange POW's from their conflict.
TEXT.Italian: %s1 and %s2 have agreed to exchange POW's from their conflict.
TEXT.Spanish: %s1 and %s2 have agreed to exchange POW's from their conflict.

TEXT.English: The POW Exchange between the %s1 and %s2 has completed.
TEXT.French: The POW Exchange between the %s1 and %s2 has completed.
TEXT.German: The POW Exchange between the %s1 and %s2 has completed.
TEXT.Italian: The POW Exchange between the %s1 and %s2 has completed.
TEXT.Spanish: The POW Exchange between the %s1 and %s2 has completed.

TEXT.English: The Non-Agression Pact between the %s1 and %s2 civilizations has come to an end.
TEXT.French: The Non-Agression Pact between the %s1 and %s2 civilizations has come to an end.
TEXT.German: The Non-Agression Pact between the %s1 and %s2 civilizations has come to an end.
TEXT.Italian: The Non-Agression Pact between the %s1 and %s2 civilizations has come to an end.
TEXT.Spanish: The Non-Agression Pact between the %s1 and %s2 civilizations has come to an end.

TEXT.English: The alliance between %s1 and %s2 has been dissolved.
TEXT.French: The alliance between %s1 and %s2 has been dissolved.
TEXT.German: The alliance between %s1 and %s2 has been dissolved.
TEXT.Italian: The alliance between %s1 and %s2 has been dissolved.
TEXT.Spanish: The alliance between %s1 and %s2 has been dissolved.

TEXT.English: Out of spite, the %s1 have introduced the ambassadors of the %s2 to us.
TEXT.French: Par dépit, les %s1 nous ont introduits auprès des Ambassadeurs des %s2.
TEXT.German: Aus reiner Gehässigkeit haben uns die %s1 Abgesandte der %s2 vorgestellt.
TEXT.Italian: Out of spite, the %s1 have introduced the ambassadors of the %s2 to us.
TEXT.Spanish: Out of spite, the %s1 have introduced the ambassadors of the %s2 to us.

TEXT.English: For reasons of their own, the %s1 have introduced the ambassadors of the %s2 to us.
TEXT.French: Pour leurs propres raisons, les %s1 nous ont introduits auprès des Ambassadeurs des %s2.
TEXT.German: Aus Gründen, die nur sie selbst kennen, haben uns die %s1 Abgesandte der %s2 vorgestellt.
TEXT.Italian: For reasons of their own, the %s1 have introduced the ambassadors of the %s2 to us.
TEXT.Spanish: For reasons of their own, the %s1 have introduced the ambassadors of the %s2 to us.

TEXT.English: Our good friends, the %s1, have taken it upon themself to introduce the charming ambassadors from the %s2 to us.
TEXT.French: Nos Amis, les %s1, ont pris l'initiative de nous introduire auprès des charmants des %s2.
TEXT.German: Unsere guten Freunde, die %s1, haben sich die Mühe gemacht, uns die charmanten Abgesandten der %s2 vorzustellen.
TEXT.Italian: Our good friends, the %s1, have taken it upon themself to introduce the charming ambassadors from the %s2 to us.
TEXT.Spanish: Our good friends, the %s1, have taken it upon themself to introduce the charming ambassadors from the %s2 to us.

TEXT.English: In some sinister plot, the %s1 have introduced some shady ambassadors who claim to hail from the %s2 to us.
TEXT.French: Dans un sinistre complot, les %s1 nous ont introduit auprès Ambassadeurs de l'ombre qui réclament la grêle de la part des %s2.
TEXT.German: In einer undurchsichtigen Verschwörung haben die %s1 einige dubiose Abgesandte vorgestellt, die behaupten, Grüße der %s2 zu überbringen.
TEXT.Italian: In some sinister plot, the %s1 have introduced some shady ambassadors who claim to hail from the %s2 to us.
TEXT.Spanish: In some sinister plot, the %s1 have introduced some shady ambassadors who claim to hail from the %s2 to us.

TEXT.English: Our friends, the %s1, have introduced the charming ambassadors from the %s2 to us.
TEXT.French: Nos Amis, les %s1, nous ont introduits auprès des charmants Ambassadeurs des %s2.
TEXT.German: Unsere Freunde, die %s1, haben uns die charmanten Abgesandten der %s2 vorgestellt.
TEXT.Italian: Our friends, the %s1, have introduced the charming ambassadors from the %s2 to us.
TEXT.Spanish: Our friends, the %s1, have introduced the charming ambassadors from the %s2 to us.

TEXT.English: Embassies allow more advanced form of diplomacy.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Can Sign [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Open Borders [COLOR_REVERT]Agreements.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Can Sign [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Pacts.[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Can Sign [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Free Trade Agreements.[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Can Sign [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Non-Aggression Pacts.[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_GREEN]Improves[COLOR_REVERT] Diplomatic Relations Between Countries.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Allows For the [COLOR_GREEN]Trade of Workers[COLOR_REVERT] Between Countries.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Allows For the [COLOR_GREEN]Trade of Certain Military Units[COLOR_REVERT] Between Countries.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Allows players to see inside the other nation's capital city.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]If Recalled, Players Will Sour Diplomatic Relations Between Countries.[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Enemy Spy Missions are More Likely to Succeed, Due to the Increased Familiarity Between Your Countries.[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Allows the other player to see into your capital city![COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.French: Les Ambassades permettent une forme plus avancée de diplomatie.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Peut signer des Traités de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Libre Passage[COLOR_REVERT].[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Peut signer des [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pactes Défensifs.[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_GREEN]Améliore[COLOR_REVERT] les Relations diplomatique entre les Etats.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Permet l'échange d' [COLOR_GREEN]Ouvriers[COLOR_REVERT] entre Etats.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Permet l'échange d' [COLOR_GREEN]Unités militaires[COLOR_REVERT] entre Etats.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Permet aux joueurs de voir la Capitale de l'autre Nation.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Si L'Ambassadeur est rappelé, créé de la tension diplomatique entre les Etats.[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Les Mission d'espionnage ont plus de chance de succès, en raison de la proximité entre les Etats.[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Votre Capitale est du coup visible par l'autre Nation![COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.German: Botschaften ermöglichen eine fortgeschrittenere Form der Diplomatie.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Kann [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Offene Grenzen [COLOR_REVERT]beschließen.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Kann [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensivpakte[COLOR_REVERT]beschließen.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_GREEN]Verbessert[COLOR_REVERT] diplomatische Beziehungen zwischen den Nationen.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Ermöglicht den [COLOR_GREEN]Handel mit Bautrupps[COLOR_REVERT] zwischen den Nationen.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Ermöglicht den [COLOR_GREEN]Handel mit bestimmten Militäreinheiten[COLOR_REVERT] zwischen den Nationen. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Ermöglicht es den Spielern in die Hauptstadt einer anderen Nation zu sehen.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Wenn der Botschafter abberufen wird verschlechtert dich das diplomatische Verhältnis.[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Feindliche Spionagemissionen sind öfter erfolgreich durch die verbesserten Kenntnisse der Länder voneinander.[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Ermöglicht es dem anderen Spieler in deine Hauptstadt zu sehen![COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Italian: Embassies allow more advanced form of diplomacy.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Can Sign [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Open Borders [COLOR_REVERT]Agreements.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Can Sign [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Pacts.[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_GREEN]Improves[COLOR_REVERT] Diplomatic Relations Between Countries.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Allows For the [COLOR_GREEN]Trade of Workers[COLOR_REVERT] Between Countries.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Allows For the [COLOR_GREEN]Trade of Certain Military Units[COLOR_REVERT] Between Countries.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Allows players to see inside the other nation's capital city.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]If Recalled, Players Will Sour Diplomatic Relations Between Countries.[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Enemy Spy Missions are More Likely to Succeed, Due to the Increased Familiarity Between Your Countries.[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Allows the other player to see into your capital city![COLOR_REVERT]
TEXT.Spanish: Embassies allow more advanced form of diplomacy.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Can Sign [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Open Borders [COLOR_REVERT]Agreements.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Can Sign [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Defensive Pacts.[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_GREEN]Improves[COLOR_REVERT] Diplomatic Relations Between Countries.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Allows For the [COLOR_GREEN]Trade of Workers[COLOR_REVERT] Between Countries.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Allows For the [COLOR_GREEN]Trade of Certain Military Units[COLOR_REVERT] Between Countries.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Allows players to see inside the other nation's capital city.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]If Recalled, Players Will Sour Diplomatic Relations Between Countries.[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Enemy Spy Missions are More Likely to Succeed, Due to the Increased Familiarity Between Your Countries.[COLOR_REVERT][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Allows the other player to see into your capital city![COLOR_REVERT]

TEXT.English: Free Trade Agreement:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Increases Trade Revenue[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Increases Gold From Trade Missions[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Lowers the cost of espionage in member nations[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Increases the Spread of Corporations between member nations[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May anger rivals
TEXT.French: Accord de libre échange:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Augmente les revenus des échanges[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Réduit le coût de l'espionnage entre les nations[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Augmente la propagation des Corporations entre les nations[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Peut détériorer les relations avec les rivaux
TEXT.German: Free Trade Agreement:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Increases Trade Revenue[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Lowers the cost of espionage in member nations[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Increases the Spread of Corporations between member nations[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May anger rivals
TEXT.Italian: Free Trade Agreement:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Increases Trade Revenue[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Lowers the cost of espionage in member nations[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Increases the Spread of Corporations between member nations[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May anger rivals
TEXT.Spanish: Free Trade Agreement:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Increases Trade Revenue[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Lowers the cost of espionage in member nations[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Increases the Spread of Corporations between member nations[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May anger rivals

TEXT.English: A Right of Passage Agreement allows only non-agressive units to pass through your civilizations, including trade. Useful for when players want to continue trade but stop enemy troop movements.
TEXT.French: Un Droit de Passage permet uniquement aux unités civiles de passer aux travers des frontières des civilisations, incluant le commerce. Pratique lorsque les joueurs veulent continuer les échanges commerciaux tout en stoppant les mouvement de troupes ennemis.
TEXT.German: Eine Passiererlaubnis ermöglicht nichtmilitärischen Einheiten durch Deine Zivilisation zu ziehen und auch den Handel. Das ist sinnvoll für Spieler, die den Handel weiterführen aber den Durchzug der feindlichen Truppen unterbinden möchten.
TEXT.Italian: A Right of Passage Agreement allows only non-agressive units to pass through your civilizations, including trade. Useful for when players want to continue trade but stop enemy troop movements.
TEXT.Spanish: A Right of Passage Agreement allows only non-agressive units to pass through your civilizations, including trade. Useful for when players want to continue trade but stop enemy troop movements.

TEXT.English: No! They must be taught a lesson!
TEXT.French: Non! Il faut leur donner une leçon!
TEXT.German: Nein! Sie müssen ihre Lektion lernen!
TEXT.Italian: No! They must be taught a lesson!
TEXT.Spanish: No! They must be taught a lesson!

TEXT.German: Manche Kriege sind es wert zu kämpfen...

TEXT.English: Not until their blood fills the streets of their capital city!
TEXT.French: Pas avant que leur sang remplisse les rues de leur Capitale!
TEXT.German: Nicht bis das Blut die Straßen ihrer Hauptstadt füllt!
TEXT.Italian: Not until their blood fills the streets of their capital city!
TEXT.Spanish: Not until their blood fills the streets of their capital city!

TEXT.French: N'abandonnerai Jamais! Jamais je ne me rendrai!

TEXT.English: U.N. Resolution (Abolition of Capital Punishment) (+1 ([ICON_HEALTHY]) in All Cities)
TEXT.French: Résolution de l'ONU: [BOLD]Abolition de la peine de Mort[\BOLD] (+1 [ICON_HEALTHY])

TEXT.English: U.N. Resolution (Humanitarian Assistance for Soldiers) (+30%([ICON_HEALTHY]) for Soldiers)
TEXT.French: Résolution de l'ONU: [BOLD]Abolition de la peine de Mort[\BOLD] (+1 [ICON_HEALTHY])

TEXT.English: U.N. Resolution (Return of Captured Civilians - Noncombatants Captured during War are Returned Upon Peace)
TEXT.French: Résolution de l'ONU: [BOLD]Abolition de la peine de Mort[\BOLD] (+1 [ICON_HEALTHY])

TEXT.English: U.N. Resolution (Worldwide Exchange of Maps - Shared Geographic Knowledge)
TEXT.French: Résolution de l'ONU: [BOLD]Abolition de la peine de Mort[\BOLD] (+1 [ICON_HEALTHY])

TEXT.English: U.N. Resolution (Peace with Barbarians - Permenant Peace with Barbarians)
TEXT.French: Résolution de l'ONU: [BOLD]Abolition de la peine de Mort[\BOLD] (+1 [ICON_HEALTHY])

TEXT.English: U.N. Resolution (Abolition of City Razing - No City Razing Upon Conquest)
TEXT.French: Résolution de l'ONU: [BOLD]Abolition de la peine de Mort[\BOLD] (+1 [ICON_HEALTHY])

TEXT.English: U.N. Resolution (Fixed Borders - Culture Expansion Requires Empty Radius)
TEXT.French: Résolution de l'ONU: [BOLD]Abolition de la peine de Mort[\BOLD] (+1 [ICON_HEALTHY])

TEXT.English: U.N. Resolution (Voting Exclusion Penalty for Aggressive Wars - Temporary Exclusion of Voting Members who Launch Wars)
TEXT.French: Résolution de l'ONU: [BOLD]Abolition de la peine de Mort[\BOLD] (+1 [ICON_HEALTHY])

TEXT.English: U.N. Resolution (Victims' Rights Civilian Refugees Return Upon City Liberation)
TEXT.French: Résolution de l'ONU: [BOLD]Abolition de la peine de Mort[\BOLD] (+1 [ICON_HEALTHY])

TEXT.English: [H1]Active Senate[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Under some types of government ([LINK=CIVIC_REPRESENTATION]Representation[\LINK], [LINK=CIVIC_UNIVERSAL_SUFFRAGE]Universal Suffrage[\LINK]), the Senate can interfere with your military policy. Thus, it may invalidate your declarations of war and/or force you to sign a peace treaty with your enemies.[PARAGRAPH:2]The decisions of the Senate depend in particular on the scale of the conflict, either potential or actual, and its real interest. Thus, pursue a policy military under democratic regime becomes more difficult.[PARAGRAPH:2] However, when an opponent make unpleasant acts to your nation, by a embargo, a negative vote, an espionage mission, etc. ..., you have a sufficient pretext to go to war without Senate intervention. Any war pretext is valid for one turn and throughout the conflict in case of a declaration of war. Of course, malicious acts of enemies who are already at war against you are a pretext to circumvent the Senate.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]
TEXT.French: [H1]Sénat[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Sous certains régimes ([LINK=CIVIC_REPRESENTATION]Réprésentation[\LINK], [LINK=CIVIC_UNIVERSAL_SUFFRAGE]Suffrage Universel[\LINK]), le Sénat peut s'ingérer dans votre politique militaire. Ainsi, il peut annuler vos déclarations de guerre et/ou vous forcer à signer un traité de paix avec vos ennemis.[PARAGRAPH:2]Les décisions du Sénat dépendent notamment de l'ampleur du conflit, qu'il soit éventuel ou effectif, et de son réel intéret. Ainsi, mener une politique militaire sous régime démocratique devient plus ardu.[PARAGRAPH:2]Cependant, lorsqu'un adversaire agit d'une façon déplaisante à l'égard de votre nation, par un boycott, un vote défavorable, une mission d'espionnage, etc..., vous disposez d'un prétexte suffisant pour mener ou subir une guerre sans que le Sénat intervienne. Tout prétexte est valable un tour, puis tout au long du conflit en cas de déclaration de guerre. Bien entendu, les actes malveillants des ennemis qui sont déjà en guerre contre vous ne sauraient être des prétextes pour contourner le sénat.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Senate[COLOR_REVERT] has vetoed your declaration of war on %s1_TeamCiv
TEXT.French: Le [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sénat[COLOR_REVERT] annule votre déclaration de guerre contre %s1_TeamName (%s2_TeamCiv)

TEXT.English: An Active Senate Overides Wars Unless Valid War Pretexts Exist.

TEXT.T: Your government reminds you that you signed the "Voting Exclusion Penalty for Aggressive Wars" of the %s1_VoteSourcename.

TEXT.English: The possession of nuclear weapons reduces the chances that your rivals will consider a conflict against you.
So be it. But if we need you at the table, your absense may not be to your advantage.
TEXT.French: So be it. But if we need you at the table, your absense may not be to your advantage.
TEXT.German: So be it. But if we need you at the table, your absense may not be to your advantage.
TEXT.Italian: So be it. But if we need you at the table, your absense may not be to your advantage.
TEXT.Spanish: So be it. But if we need you at the table, your absense may not be to your advantage.

TEXT.English: So be it. But the next time we meet, it may be on the battlefield!
TEXT.French: So be it. But the next time we meet, it may be on the battlefield!
TEXT.German: So be it. But the next time we meet, it may be on the battlefield!
TEXT.Italian: So be it. But the next time we meet, it may be on the battlefield!
TEXT.Spanish: So be it. But the next time we meet, it may be on the battlefield!

TEXT.English: What a shame. My diplomats enjoyed your openness and all it revealed about you.
TEXT.French: What a shame. My diplomats enjoyed your openness and all it revealed about you.
TEXT.German: What a shame. My diplomats enjoyed your openness and all it revealed about you.
TEXT.Italian: What a shame. My diplomats enjoyed your openness and all it revealed about you.
TEXT.Spanish: What a shame. My diplomats enjoyed your openness and all it revealed about you.

TEXT.English: If you wish. I will contact you when it suits me.
TEXT.French: If you wish. I will contact you when it suits me.
TEXT.German: If you wish. I will contact you when it suits me.
TEXT.Italian: If you wish. I will contact you when it suits me.
TEXT.Spanish: If you wish. I will contact you when it suits me.

TEXT.English: If you insist. But I have enjoyed your absense.
TEXT.French: If you insist. But I have enjoyed your absense.
TEXT.German: If you insist. But I have enjoyed your absense.
TEXT.Italian: If you insist. But I have enjoyed your absense.
TEXT.Spanish: If you insist. But I have enjoyed your absense.

TEXT.English: Excellent! There are many things you have to offer us.
TEXT.French: Excellent! There are many things you have to offer us.
TEXT.German: Excellent! There are many things you have to offer us.
TEXT.Italian: Excellent! There are many things you have to offer us.
TEXT.Spanish: Excellent! There are many things you have to offer us.

TEXT.English: United Nations condemned %s1_Civic! The Civilizations which chose this civic lose the respect of the others.
TEXT.French: Les Nations Unies condamnent [NUM1:le:la:les:les] %s1_Civic ! Les Civilisations qui ont choisi cette doctrine perdent l'estime des autres.

TEXT.English: [H1]Condamned Civic[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]The United Nations can vote on resolution of condemnation of a civic. If and only if this civic is adopted by one of the voting players. Are condemnable by the United Nations, some of the most extremist civics. [PARAGRAPH:2]Choosing a condemned civic generate a diplomatic penalty from the voting members and exclude the civilization to the clan of members which can vote, which in itself is not always a bad thing (as you assess the risks and benefits of such a situation.)[PARAGRAPH:2]It is possible that a AI player proposes such a resolution and pass it, in which case it can influence the course of the game. But from a human point of view, the interest is more subtile. It allows to turn some civilizations against another. Indeed, if you want to attack an opponent who has a state religion shared by you and your allies, but he chose a different religious doctrine, you can try to condemn it to make it a pariat and attack without offending your brothers in faith, even with their assistance.[PARAGRAPH:2]From a historical point of view, the interest is basically to be able to condemn the reform among others.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]
TEXT.French: [H1]Doctrine condamnée[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Les autorités apostoliques et les Nations-Unies peuvent faire voter des résolution de condamnation d'une doctrine. Si et seulement si cette doctrine est adoptée par un des joueurs votants. Ne sont condamnables par l'ONU, que certaines doctrines parmi les plus extrêmistes. Et ne sont condamnables par le palais apostolique, que les doctrines religieuses impliquant le choix d'une religion d'Etat.[PARAGRAPH:2]Opter pour une cotrine condamnée génère un malus diplomatique de la part des membres votants, et exclue la civilisation du clan des membres aptes à voter, ce qui, en soi, n'est pas toujours une mauvaise chose (à vous de jauger les risques et les avantages d'une telle situation).[PARAGRAPH:2]Il se peut qu'un joueur IA propose ce genre de résolution et qu'elle passe, auquel cas cela peut influer sur le cours de la partie. Mais d'un point de vue humain, l'intéret est plus subtil. Il permet notamment de retourner certaines civilisations contre une autre. Notamment dans le cadre du palais apostolique. En effet, si vous souhaitez attaquer un adversaire qui a une religion d'Etat partagée par vous et par vos alliés, mais qu'il a choisi une doctrine religieuse différente, vous pouvez tenter de la condamner afin d'en faire un pariat et de l'attaquer sans froisser vos frères de foi, voire même avec leur concours.[PARAGRAPH:2]D'un point de vue historique, l'intéret est, à la base, de pouvoir condamner la réforme, ou les croisades, notamment.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]

TEXT.English: UN won't be able to propose a resolution to make a resource disappeared/reappeared.
[BOLD]Prohibition of Coal[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Makes the Coal resource disappeared
[BOLD]Prohibition of Fur[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Makes the Fur resource disappeared
[BOLD]Prohibition of Ivory[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Makes the Ivory resource disappeared
[BOLD]Prohibition of Whale Fishing[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Makes the Whale resource disappeared
[BOLD]Prohibition of Whale Fishing[\BOLD][NEWLINE]Makes the Whale resource disappeared

TEXT.T: A source of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s1_BonusName[COLOR_REVERT] was abandoned near %s2_CityName.
A source of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s1_BonusName[COLOR_REVERT] was reactivated near %s2_CityName.

TEXT.English: Paying war reparations reimburses for losses caused by wars. War reparations are an expensive means to repair relations between former enemies.
